page.title: 09ENTERTAINMENT IN PERTH
page.content: Perth has always been a theatrical town which promotes cultural activities. {PERTH THEATRE}is the main centre of cultural entertainment;10 shows per year and an annual pantomime are staged.The highest number of seats occupied per show is 91%.This year to celebrate its 50th anniversary, the theatre is opening the new season after carrying out extensive backstage improvements.Many of the performances involve local schoolchildren and touring companies are made most welcome."Peter Pan" and "Torwatletie". are in this year's programme. { { THE PLAYHOUSE CINEMA }has 3 screens and changes its programme weekly. {DISCOS}attract mostly young people, and several can be found in the town. The Grampian Hotel and Salutation Hotel hold discos every weekend.
